Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's in Cryptopia's best interest to keep coins and not delist them, so they can make trading fees. They saw selfish mining attacks, and paused trading to be safe. We are not sure yet which exchanges have gotten hit with a double spend, because confirmation requirements were too low

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> Holy #hush-github commits Batman!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> @Art0077 , 24 hour price drop was because of a price spike  (pump and dump) at Coinroom on the 22nd 0700 AEST, Hush/PLN pairing. Look at the 1 day chart or weekly chart.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> 
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/407861562108542988/493245267613581322/hush_market.png

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it wasn't quite a pump and dump, it's that the exchange has very little liquidity. We lost maybe 90% of our trading volume with Cryptopia paused

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that means small buy/sells in the orderbook move the price a lot

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> somebody bought a large chunk of the orderbook, so price was inflated for a bit until people adjusted their orders, some people sold at a nice price for a few minutes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but i wouldn't quite call it a pump and dump üòÉ People will definitely be trying to game this liquidity issue, tho. Expect our price to be very volatile until cryptopia is unpaused

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> some people will try to arbitrage from HUSH/BTC , HUSH/USD and HUSH/PLN, which now have big spreads

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> Interestingly, Cryptopia will still think for a long time about  the return of trading?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> they are waiting for KMD dpow in the next release.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> many wheels are turning, KMD notary nodes are working out the last few bugs with Hush

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> once all notary nodes are running Hush in production, that is when end users and exchanges can upgrade

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> As I understand it is necessary to have patience, it is necessary to wait a little?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> until NN's are running, sending data to KMD + BTC, the newest release doesn't have the data it needs, to protect against attacks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> I think that protecting dpow will allow HUSH to declare itself as a reliable coin, it is appreciated

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> very few coins have this right now, other than KMD and KMD asset chains

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> only CHIPS and GAME have this, as external coins. Hush is the 3rd, and first ZEC fork (CHIPS and GAME are BTC 0.15 forks)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I am also helping a few other coins add KMD dpow, which is why I started writing https://github.com/leto/mastering_komodo_dpow/blob/master/mastering_komodo_dpow.md

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> BTCH already has this protection as a KMD asset chain, to clarify

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> @dukeleto And is there something similar to other projects?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> not that I know of
